topic.title: Cluster Settings
topic.shortdesc: The Settings menu sets the global settings for your Couchbase Server instance. Full Administrators and Cluster Administrators can configure cluster settings.

body.p: Use the Cluster tab to configure the cluster name, RAM quota, and Index settings.

section.title: Configure Cluster
section.p: You can set the cluster setting:

entry.p: The name that was given during the initial setup, which you can edit in the UI, change with the CLI command or with a call to the REST API:
entry.codeblock: couchbase-cli setting-cluster -c localhost -u Admin -p Pass --cluster-name="New Cluster Name"
curl -u Admin:Pass -X POST http://localhost:8091/pools/default -d clusterName="New Cluster Name"

section.title: Cluster RAM Quota
section.p: You can set the following RAM settings:

row.entry: The per node RAM that is available to Couchbase services limited to the smallest node in the cluster.

The per node memory allocation for the key-value cache used by the data service. At a minimum, it cannot be made smaller than the sum per node bucket quota of all buckets combined. This value can be adjusted in the UI, with the CLI or with the REST API.
Example: couchbase-cli setting-cluster -c localhost -u Admin -p Pass --cluster-ramsize=600
orcurl -u Admin:Pass -X POST http://localhost:8091/pools/default -d memoryQuota=600

This setting controls the buffer cache size of the index storage layer. The specified memory is pre-allocated as soon as the indexer starts up, and is shared with all indexes created on the node. The total memory usage of the indexer process will be the buffer cache plus the size of various internal data structures and queues. You can adjust the per-node memory in the UI, with the CLI command or with the REST API.
Examplecouchbase-cli setting-cluster -c localhost -u Admin -p Pass --cluster-index-ramsize=300
orcurl -u Admin:Pass -X POST http://localhost:8091/pools/default -d indexMemoryQuota=300
This setting controls the RAM quota for Full Text search. It shows the amount of the main memory allocation for Full Text service per node.

section.title: Index Settings for Global and Memory-Optimized Indexes
section.p: You can set the following index settings:

row.entry:
The number of dedicated threads used by the Index Service. The number can be increased on multi-core machines to increase the amount of CPU available to the Indexer. The default is 4 and you can adjust it in the UI or with the REST API.
Example: curl -X POST -u Admin:Pass http://localhost:8091/settings/indexes -d indexerThreads=3

Maximum number of the committed rollback points. The default is 5 and you can adjust it in the UI or with the REST API.
Example:curl -X POST -u Admin:Pass http://localhost:8091/settings/indexes -d maxRollbackPoints=6

Adjust the logging level from least to most verbose, the options are Silent, Fatal, Error, Warn, Info, Verbose, Timing, Debug, and Trace, with the default being Debug. It is advised to leave this setting as the default unless Couchbase Support directs you to change it.
